website_summaries.verdict: This is an easy way to keep track of how much change you have in your house while also providing a place to store all your loose change.
pros: Counts all US coins and an LCD display keeps track of everything you place in the jug
The lid twists off for easy coin retrieval and you can use the plus-minus function to keep track of what you remove or if you want to add bills
cons: Some buyers said that the lid doesn't screw on tightly, but the company was always quick to replace these

customer_reviews.title: Jumbo Digital Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This may be the single worst product that I ever bought from Amazon. It is essentially a one gallon plastic orange juice container topped by a hard to screw on, hard to insert coins, inaccurate counter for the price of $21.99. While advertised as being for "ages 3 and up", any prolonged (more than five minutes) insertion of coins is actually PAINFUL for an adult. Oh, yes, did I mention that unless you insert the coins with the repetitive dexterity of a trained surgeon, the counter will make an error of between .01 and $1.00. That's probably what the manufacturer should be charging for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W Turbitt

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I received this Wednesday and started filling it up on Thursday. I’m going to use it for my silver coins only. I have a different bank for my pennies but so far I am really satisfied with it. Today my lil cousin is coming over to help me roll these up then I’ll start again.
customer_reviews.author: Cdyana

customer_reviews.title: Top notch service from company! Great products, too!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item and when it arrived, I noticed the top piece did not screw on snugly so I sent the company a message about the issue and they sent me a whole brand new one with a complimentary gift for my troubles! I did not even have to send the other one back! Top notch service for Filltech for making me a happy customer! This coin counter is just big enough for my collection and now I can track what I have thus far! Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Bartolotta

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Coin counter arrived sooner than promised; very quickly! Was pleasantly surprised at the size and my perception of the quality of the jar, and the handle which is very handy. I loaded $38.50, one coin at a time. I had been concerned about the loading process, as I had gifted other somewhat similar banks to several of my grandkids, with problems arising quickly upon attempting to load the bank. No such problems here! I purchased this bank for myself, wanting and hoping for a more substantial product than those I had purchased previously. My hopes were rewarded! I am very pleased, and would recommend this "coin counter bank" to anyone looking for more than a toy!
customer_reviews.author: JERZEYBOY

customer_reviews.title: Great invention!  Tends to mix up coins but does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nifty little invention. Not too big, not too small and I love the handle! At times it mixes up dimes and pennies, and sometimes nickels with quarters but gives you a good idea of how much money you have collected. I like that it automatically turns on every time you enter a coin. Take your time and enter only one coin at a time and you'll get more of an accurate count. Helps to keep my dresser tidy, at least I don't have a pile of change covering valuable space.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetjan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't register coins accurately
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews first. The counter doesn't fit the container. The readings are off. It will count a penny as a dime for example. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Randy M

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to get accurate read
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a quarter collection that he has wanted to count for a while so I bought him this counter- he is very good about pushing the coins all the way through each time so to not confuse the machine and have it mistake a quarter for another coin... yes somehow the cents have ended up on an even number... not a divisible of 5 or even 25... I would think it would be hard for anyone to get an accurate read.
customer_reviews.author: NSKDodge

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: Decent enough. You can choose a subtract or addition feature on the top. It has a digital display of how much change is in the container. My only issue with the product is the top doesn't fully screw on and feels like it will pull off if you lift the product by the top. I probably would not recommend this product to other costumers.
customer_reviews.author: C-Smooth

customer_reviews.title: INACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: I read other reviews but bought anyway. Coins are rather hard to insert but that is minor compared to how inaccurate the counter is. At first it registered newly minted quarters as five cents and eventually just started to register just about any amount per quarter inserted. I would be better off with a regular plastic jug and keep track of amounts inserted on paper.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Need a tiny screwdriver to add batteries
customer_reviews.text: It was such a bummer that in order to add batteries (so unit can provide a coin count)... I had to unscrew the lid to the battery compartment... this wouldn’t have been frustrating had the screw not been as tiny as it was. I ended up ordering an eyeglass screwdriver set. I never replaced the lid & the batteries still worked... Aside from that it’s a good household item.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: It's a coin jar.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dad. It works as described. He's thrilled and I don't have hear about piles of coins anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Ellene

customer_reviews.title: Find a better product..
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Cheap plastic container with the screw on top that won't thread correctly to the container. That leaves you with a container full of coins with a lid that falls off if you move it. Attempts to contact seller ended with a telephone transfer to a property management company on the East coast..
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Cute and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I thought it was neat. It works great for the most part. Sometimes it confuses dimes and pennies but I'm okay with that, it's not much of a difference. The lid had plus and minus signs for use if there is a coin miscalculation or if you want to open the top to add paper money. Over all I like it and think it would be a great gift for a kid if you'd like them to start saving money and enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: shugafoot

customer_reviews.title: It Actually "WORKED!"
customer_reviews.text: I especially liked the fact that this one worked the way it is supposed to. The first one I purchased from Amazon, worked "UNTIL" I tried to push a quarter into it. The little roller got stuck and that was the end of that. I trashed it, and ordered this one. I'm so glad that this one works, even with quarters. The other smaller one I think was from a different company. Much applause to this company for making one that "WORKS."
customer_reviews.author: Randolph L. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Good quality plastic jar 🏺 the coin counts the money 💰 but inaccurate from time to time. But packaging could have been better. Since my brother didn’t know I was going to get him a new one that I lost, the item was exposed and had mailing label 🏷 on products box 📦 was very disappointed ☹️ about that
customer_reviews.author: paydro2208Top Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I had change saved in miscellaneous containers and they would always get full and hard to lift. This bank will hold hundreds of dollars and easy to lift with the handle. I don't know if it's completely accurate to the penny but seems to be very close and it's nice to know how much you have when you take to those coin exchange because my bank did it "free" for me but my count and theirs was about $20.00 difference so I really don't trust them! I think it's a great investment and a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Mar-Mar

customer_reviews.title: WELL WORTH THE PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased. Not one complaint from me. It holds more coins than I expected it to. I had a number of Crown Royal coin bags in my closet before I purchased this jar. Now all I have is penny bags. I presently have $275.00 dollars of nickles, dimes, quarters, and half dollars in my jar. I decorated the jar with laptop/skateboard stickers.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I like this coin bank. The lid is the counter and it is powered by a single aaa battery. Also it is a lot bigger than the pictures show. I have about 22 dollars in charge in mine and it is bare at the bottom. Hasn't moved an inch. Great product. One negative is if you grab the lid it might come off. It does not close firmly. Loose fit.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson as a gift. He requested a bank of sorts that would count his coins. He's 4 years old, so it was a little difficult for him to push the coins thru but after he did it several times, he got the hang of it. While it is a nice size, it is described as jumbo, and I wouldn't describe it that way....not as big as I thought it would be, but sufficient for a 4 year old anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great item, and a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a large glass jar for years to collect the coins in the laundry or in the couch cushions. When I saw this item I had to have it. It's been fun watching to total grow .So much so that I put the change in my purse in the coin counter at the end of the week. Simple design, large enough to store all that extra change for a long time. Works exactly as promised. Grandkids even want to put their pennies in it too!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Madsen

customer_reviews.title: Works well unless you want to add dollars
customer_reviews.text: It works, but my big disappointment is the add subtract feature. So far I can only find a way to add or subtract one cent at a time! So if I wanted to add in a few bills I’d have to hit a button literally 100 times for every dollar I added. But it’s easy to use and functional and has a large capacity for coins, which is really what I wanted it for. Does not come with batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna

customer_reviews.title: Good and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a gift exchange and someone thought it was stupid so I swapped gifts with them and kept it myself, I wanted to keep it anyway lol. This is a really good bank and it keeps count accurately, it's not to big and not to small. I'd buy it again for a not so uppity gift exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Bertels

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to put batteries in
customer_reviews.text: Im upset because i cant open where the battery goes, it requires an specific screw driver and it doesnt state taht any where. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: thalia

customer_reviews.title: A piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.text: The cap is the most important part of it, and it didn't even function out of the box. With every coin I would insert the reader would just display a bunch of zeros and restart. The entire thing feels like chap plastic. I would recommend looking for another product as this one just isn't worth the price it is set as.
customer_reviews.author: Mattdb00

customer_reviews.title: very good coin bank
customer_reviews.text: big jar, helps me save more coins than a ordinary piggy bank, and its easy to use, just drop your coin in the slot and it reads the coin you droppedin and calculates how much you have in the jar.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K

customer_reviews.title: Quality isn’t the best
customer_reviews.text: I mean you get what you get but I don’t know why it is called Jumbo because it looks pretty small to me compared to most you see. The quality of the product is why I took two stars away though, I unpackaged it to scruffs and scratches all over and I can’t seem to twist the lid shut. Once it gets close to being on all the way, it just gets loose again.
customer_reviews.author: Reagan Hall

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bank For Children
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our 5 yr old granddaughter. Easy for her to use and the digital readout shows both, the value of the coin entered and the new total. Made of thick plastic instead of glass to help ensure safety should she drop/knock it over.
customer_reviews.author: noshhtSherlock

customer_reviews.title: Jumbo Digital Coin Counter Bank
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to use this when it arrived. I expected it would be larger. It’s nice and sturdy. My only hang up is the counter count pennies as dimes so the actual amount in the bank is off. Not a huge deal beaker as it’s not a high level coin machine like in the bank branches.
customer_reviews.author: Catrachita50

customer_reviews.title: Great idea!
customer_reviews.text: In theory, this is a great idea - and it may be wonderful for kids.... but for me, it's too hard to put the coins through the slot and quite honestly, I don't have enough time for that. I just unscrew the top and put it in there...
customer_reviews.author: CanBMckin

customer_reviews.title: 4 months later . . .
customer_reviews.text: it was ok in the beginning . . . . 4 month later, the counter quit working and the lid doesn't close tight enough to lift the bank with . . . very disappointed . . . mo better than a milk jug now
customer_reviews.author: Heart

customer_reviews.title: very large
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this item, much better than a previous model I had purchased. This allows you to subtract or add to the amount in the container without having to push the coins through the opening. It will hold several coins due to the large size!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s Actually Big Enough!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for a large coin bank for awhile, and this one is great! I wasn’t sure how big it would be until I actually received it, and now I see that it is more than adequate to hold and count all my coins. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: TankerGirl

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my boyfriend to store his stash of change. He gives it 4 stars because it suits the purpose. It keeps accurate count as long as you take your time inserting each coin. Other reviewers are right in saying it’s a little hard to insert the coins. Patience is needed :). We like the handle. Overall, seems a little over-priced for the quality of the product. But it still suits the purpose!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren K. Renard (Palazzolo)

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: This product is not worth the price. The lid does not fit on the very cheap plastic bottle. Just sits on top. It's difficult to push the coins in as well. I'm sure it will break very soon.
customer_reviews.author: ChiBuyer

customer_reviews.title: My Assistant Penny Pincher
customer_reviews.text: It does it's job and it does it well. The only drawback is removing change; you have to manually adjust the tally of the coinage, but that's no reason to take a star away. It's just life.
customer_reviews.author: Shank Shizank

customer_reviews.title: Great Find!
customer_reviews.text: After collecting spare change for years, I was looking for something to help me keep up with how much I was saving. The jar definitely exceeded my expectations. I was expecting something small and to only hold a few coins. After adding coins, however, it’s not even halfway full. And again, I’ve been collecting change for a few years. Inserting quarters takes a little effort, but it’s not a big deal. It also lets you subtract the amount if you ever need to dip in the jar. Great find! 😄
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT recommend
customer_reviews.text: The cap doesn’t stay on the jar and the digital screen stopped working. The batteries are fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: “Large” 😂 bank counter
customer_reviews.text: #1 it looked bigger online compared to holding it in my hands.. #2 the counter often counts pennies as dimes.. so for every penny I put in that counted as a dime, I had to set a dime aside so not to throw off the count to much and doing this meant the count would be off for example, it counted 20 pennies as dimes, so u put the 20 dimes in which is 2.00 BUT since the pennies were already in but miscounted it would be off .20 cent..
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Just got it and put about 30 dollars worth of change in it and it's easy to use. It's just one at a time but I checked to make sure it was counting everything up and it didn't miss a beat.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Schenebeck

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Does its job and does it well. Love to just put my spare change it it and it shows you the balance all the time when you put a coin in I just love it!
customer_reviews.author: Joey Goya

customer_reviews.title: Coin Counting
customer_reviews.text: I did not find this coin counter hard to insert. However if you fake insert it will count that as a point. so you have to make sure you push it all the way through. But the + - buttons allow you to add or subtract money.
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Easy and informative!
customer_reviews.text: Now that I have been using this for a few weeks, I have to say it is really great! Very easy to use, and it calculates the total $ amount with each coin. It 'knows' the denomination as soon as you drop one it, and adds up the total that is in the jar. I have barely covered the bottom and am already up to $15.00 in a few days. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Does not count correctly
customer_reviews.text: Counts pennies as dimes. Tried to reset and clean the slot but still was incredible inaccurate
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: This Coin Counter makes me WANT to save money!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I had a coin counter for years and years, finally died, and we purchased the Jumbo Digital Coin Counter. It holds a ton of coins, and it's just so much fun to see the total rise and rise! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Ellen Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Ignore the reviews that say it is hard to put in the coins, it is not accurate, the lid does not fit. The lid screwed right on no problem. I then commenced to putting in over $55 in change. No issues with the coins going in. I did not see a single inaccurate count. Estimating by the $55 that I dropped in, it probably holds about $500. Depending on denomination of course. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Performs as expected.
customer_reviews.text: In my humble experience I gave this item 5 stars because a product only needs to deliver what it was designed to do to receive those 5 stars. It does not need to be perfect nor free from improvements. This item, so far, performs according to the specs and expectations.
customer_reviews.author: anonomous486

customer_reviews.title: COUNTING MADE EASY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed these digitable counting jars for quite a while now .....bought two on sale this past Christmas now they are all filled ....saw these jars and purchased two ....nice and large will take some time to fill these treasures ....put the batteries in and you are ready to go!!!
customer_reviews.author: billy52

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I’m like a kid with a new toy. I love it, I empty my wallet with all my change and it’s amazing how quickly it adds up.
customer_reviews.author: teresa hedrick

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift for my brother for Christmas and he loves it. Sometimes you have to add the money in there using the buttons on the top because it doesnt recognize it but other than that it works good.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Very cool coin bank
customer_reviews.text: I have saved change for years in old jars. I wish I knew how much money I have accumulated. This invention works great. I have an accurate and continuous accounting of my spare change.
customer_reviews.author: ezgojoe

customer_reviews.title: Not JUMBO at all! Same size as regular ones sold. Not worth $30
customer_reviews.text: Was WAY smaller than pictured. Did not have the handle as shown in the picture for a JUMBO bank. Looks to be the same size as the cheaper banks of this kind with no handle just a small plastic jar. Not worth $30!
customer_reviews.author: Proud Grandma!

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Kinda hurts to put coins in after a while because of the technology of how it counts. Great otherwise though good for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Tarbox

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Keeping this...dont feel like sending it back..but not worth the money...disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Lucyna Evans

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: GETS THE JOB DONE IDK WAZUP WITH THE FOGGY BOTTLE I WANT TO SEE MY PENNIES CLEARLY LOL STILL HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.author: ELECTRONIC PROS

customer_reviews.title: what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Works well 90% of the time. Sometimes it doesn't register pennies or registers dimes as a penny so just watch carefully and adjust manually as needed. Other than that, it does the job for the price
customer_reviews.author: David Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift for Savers
customer_reviews.text: This is a gift but I'm sure my grandson is going to like it because he loves to save coins.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Marie

customer_reviews.title: The change is piling up!
customer_reviews.text: At the end of the day I empty my pockets of coins. Some days I put in a few coins, other days a lot. After a week, $10.94. Multiply that by 52 weeks ( a year), and you have well over $500. Not bad, eh? Try it, it's fun.
customer_reviews.author: Bob W.

customer_reviews.title: Better than a piggy bank
customer_reviews.text: Item mostly works correctly. The biggest issue I noticed is that it mixes up pennies and dimes sometimes. There is an option to add and subtract the amount needed, so not a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: Blingger07

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for kids and adults to collect your coins and keep count.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl W. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Coin counting fun
customer_reviews.text: This coin counter will help reduce the time it takes to wrap my coins for the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Niecie B.

customer_reviews.title: For coins only
customer_reviews.text: My Grandson loves it. Can keep accurate account of how much money he has in coins.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for any age!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son. He always has loose change all over the house. This is perfect for him to keep all his change in one place. The added bonus is he knows how much change he has in the jug. He is super happy with it. I’ll be ordering more at a later date. Grand babies and maybe one for myself. Thank you, Belinda
customer_reviews.author: Belinda Anders

customer_reviews.title: working great.
customer_reviews.text: We have put $57.96 in so far! Our hose was broken into last night and THAT was the only thing that was stolen....hmmmm. HAS to be a great product. It was sturdy. Well packaged. Plus delivered very fast!
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Rochester

customer_reviews.title: Jumbo Jar but Tiny Screw Dilemma
customer_reviews.text: I love that it is light, has a screw top and a handle to carry the jar. I have been unable to unscrew the screw to install the battery. Not the easiest and hope I can eventually do it. It is a very very tiny screw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Product; Reasonably Priced
customer_reviews.text: Just received this a couple of days ago. Bigger than I thought, but pleased just the same. Well made, very sturdy. So far works great.
customer_reviews.author: Shorty

customer_reviews.title: Fun Product
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Perfect B-day gift for son looking for a large container to transfer all the plastic cups full of coins he had collected. I had fun depositing $60 in coins and watching the counter add it up before giving it to him! Based on the $60 of coins put in, seems like container will hold more than a few hundred $ in coins. Son said, "thank you for cool gift"!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia S.

customer_reviews.title: Big Coin Counter Savings Jar
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for the wife. She loves it! Loves knowing how much she has saved at the input of a coin. Other family members want one too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Z

customer_reviews.title: Fix lose top.
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot the only problem was the lose top but for my lose change nothing a little duct tape can't fix 😉.thank again.
customer_reviews.author: Dex Dexter

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BANK
customer_reviews.text: Love the bank, it holds a lot of coins & accurate
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Coin Star watch out!
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. You will be surprise how fast the coins add up. Best yet no more guessing if coinstar is adding coins correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Jess M.

customer_reviews.title: Its amazing how you can save everytime you break a dollar
customer_reviews.text: It has been years since I had a piggy bank, especially one that can count for you. I did not really I saved so much in change. Its amazing how you can save everytime you break a dollar.
customer_reviews.author: JULIA A. BROWN

customer_reviews.title: Awesome coin counter.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really cool, and hold a lot of coins. I’ve got $50 in it so far and it hasn’t reached the bottom of the handle yet. It does sometimes confuse pennys and dimes, but not enough to make that big a difference in the total count.
customer_reviews.author: Todd M.

customer_reviews.title: Way too small to be called "jumbo"
customer_reviews.text: This is anything but "jumbo"! It's the size of a coffee container.
customer_reviews.author: Hawk

customer_reviews.title: The lid does not screw on tight
customer_reviews.text: The lid does not fit tight.It will slip and come off. It stays on good enough to put your coins in the jar which I use it for a bank. Do use the handle to lift the jar. The lid will pop off if you use the lid to pick it up. I love the size of the bank.
customer_reviews.author: karen s

customer_reviews.title: Keeps track of your loose change
customer_reviews.text: Great product, a little tough pushing the coins in. The fingers start to hurt after a bit. Still definitely worth it
customer_reviews.author: Dandy’s momma

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: This is my easy savings bank which I put my change in every night. This is working well and it's easy to get the coins in.
customer_reviews.author: Rayan Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Thought it would be larger
customer_reviews.text: The product was much smaller than I expected. I had to count my change and then store it somewhere else. If you don't have a lot of change it will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tressa boles

customer_reviews.title: You need a mini screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: Works great but make sure that you have a “mini screwdriver” to open and close the battery compartment... also doesn’t come with batteries but I’ll give it a 4/5
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pietz

customer_reviews.title: I was extremely pleased because it was larger than most i found and ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bank after the last 3 had busted under pressure. I was extremely pleased because it was larger than most i found and I was able to carry it by the handle. The auto counter is sturdy and not subject to accidental addition issues. Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: jason Hall

customer_reviews.title: decent buy
customer_reviews.text: i really enjoyed this product. if you're looking for something thats 100% clear, the jug isn't clear. it's more of like a milky white colour. its clear, it just looks weird. it sometimes counts the coins wrong
customer_reviews.author: John cortez

customer_reviews.title: Helps you want to save coins
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! The way it shows the coin denomination and total is great. We have put more than $50 into the container and it only covered about one inch of the volume!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: The product is just want I wanted I like the handle and material.
customer_reviews.author: none Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: That it breaks easily.
customer_reviews.text: Only worked accurate for 2days if that many. Started countiy the dimes as pennies and now I don't care about the amount.
customer_reviews.author: theresa sanford

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Difficult for little hands, if you don’t push the coin all the way through and it pops out the counter will still count it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, as advertised. Kids love it. But you better have a tiny screwdriver, like for eyeglass repair, to put the batteries in
customer_reviews.author: Joyce M Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Hope your not trying to surprise anyone.
customer_reviews.text: Thanks for slapping a label on the box that shows exactly what this item is so it can no longer be a Christmas gift. Husband opened the mailbox and oh look a change holder. Sweet guys.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fun to use for kids and adults alike

customer_reviews.text: It’s really cool. You throw your extra pocket change in it every day and what’s great is it keeps up w how much is in the jar, down to the penny. And it’s got a really convenient handle so you don’t have to have two hands on it to move it.

product_meta.title: Jumbo Digital Coin Counter Bank - Extra Large Savings Jar for Pennies Nickles Dimes Quarters Half Dollar and Dollar Coins | Clear Jar w/LCD Display
feature_bullets: 💰 The Teachers Choice JUMBO Coin Bank is a great all-in-one coin counter and storage device which accepts all US coins including: Pennies, Nickels, Dimes, Quarters, Half Dollars and Dollar Coins. Stores between 3000-5000 coins in total depending on the combination. Size: 6.2 x 6.2 x Inches. Accepts 2 AAA batteries.
💰 Sturdy and Light: Made of strong ABS plastic which is better than glass or ceramic piggy banks which are heavy and tend to break.

💰 Great for All Ages! Our coin counting money jar is perfect for kids! It teaches them the value of each coin, basic math principals, and responsible saving. Also great for adults; use in your house to store loose change and keep track of your accrued savings.

💰 Coin Counting and Extra Storage: Digital LCD Display automatically keeps track of savings; Easy Twist-Off Lid for coin retrieval - when coins are removed or if you want to slip in a bill, there is a simple +/- function to report the amount removed and keep a correct tally of your savings! Jumbo size allows you to store even more coins!

💰 Our Guarantee: Digital Energy makes a variety of great teaching products including teaching clocks, play money, and coin storage for kids. We stand behind all our products and we hope you will contact us with any questions or concerns. We also offer a 100% money back guarantee if you have any issues.
